maps.name: Wicked Problem Task Force (Full Map, June 2020)
maps.description:
![J+D_primary_logotype_RGB_Pink-6](https://s3.amazonaws.com/cloud.kumu.io/accounts/137908/214666/d9ad8aa6-9d0e-4b9c-813b-ce5e89c9fd18.png)


![WPTF_logo_blue](https://s3.amazonaws.com/cloud.kumu.io/accounts/137908/214666/4e23b954-d93c-4147-983f-de05326f3831.png)

The Wicked Problem Task Force is an interdisciplinary group at Journalism + Design at The New School in New York City. We use systems thinking and design to imagine worlds where people have access to the information they need to be self-governing.

This is the map of the current system we're existing in, taking into consideration everything from thirty years of toxic media policy, the rise of an economy based on harvesting attention, the collapse of local news.

Using the drop-down menu at the top, you can:
* Use this **Full Map** view to zoom in and explore the myriad connections at play. By hovering over the different texts on the map (like, "New Business Models" or "The Exploitation of Our Attention" you can highlight the different underlying patterns driving the system.
* Visit the** Neighborhood View** to explore the different sections of the map. By clicking on the buttons at the top of the screen, you can illuminate the various intersections we researched.
* Click through the **Sample Leverage Pathways #1-3** to explore how this map can be used to showcase different opportunities for change in the system. These are hypothetical leverage points that demonstrate how directly targeting one force could have ripple effects across the system.
